intro: Krubera caffra, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Krubera caffra thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
